sentences.sentence: И добивался он результатов нужных и для себя, и тогда, когда я его просил об этом, для общего дела, как вот в эти последние месяцы.

sentences.sentence: No one in Russia has confirmed how the plane came down.

I think everyone understands who is involved." Yevgeny Prigozhin died exactly two months after the start of the mutiny during which members of the Wagner group threatened to reach Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the short term, at least, it seemed the Kremlin was prepared to forgive, but perhaps not to forget.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The colours of the Ukrainian flag lit up the European Union institutions in Brussels

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: to mark the 32nd anniversary of the country's independence and the second since Russia's illegal invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The diaspora celebrations took place in Grimbergen, not far from the Belgian capital, where the role of the Western Allies was considered fundamental to the country's return to full sovereignty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Allies understood what kind of a challenge to the not only for Ukraine but to European Union to the whole civilized world Russia poses so it's our common battle that's why I'm sure this support will remain and will increase the European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said support will be offered for as long as it takes for Ukraine to be free.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And the U.S. also said there was no wavering in commitment from the allies, even after 18 months of war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I don't think that there is a question of Ukrainian allies withdrawing their support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In fact, I only see more support for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's teaching us every day what it means to fight for freedom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The two months of the Ukrainian counter-offensive have not led to significant progress in recovering territory, and some analysts think the EU is partly to blame.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: You know, the relevant arms that Ukraine needs on the field, for example, the F-16s.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The pilots still need to be trained.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This war will be over much quicker if Ukraine gets what it needs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But the president of the European Council, Charles Michel, said the EU has spent 76 billion euros in support for Ukraine and he confirmed the bloc's preparing another package worth some 50 billion euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: A Moscow court has extended the pre-trial detention of American journalist Evan Gershkovich until the end of November.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The 31-year-old US citizen has already appealed against the extension.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Gershkovich was arrested in the central Russian city of Yekaterinburg while on a reporting trip in late March. Russian authorities accused the Wall Street Journal reporter of collecting information about a business linked to the Russian military industry for the US government, something both he and the newspaper have denied. Gershkovich is the first American journalist to face espionage charges in Russia since 1986.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.sentence: The group of emerging economies formed by Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa has announced it will have six new members from next year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We have decided to invite the Argentine Republic, the Arab Republic of Egypt, the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, the Islamic Republic of Iran, the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: To become full members of BRICS, the membership will take effect from 1 January 2024.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In this regard, BRICS leaders have tasked their...

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Created with the aim of acting as a counterweight to a Western-led world order, BRICS brings together regional giants with growing political and economic weight, does not demand credentials such as respect for human rights, and has not condemned the invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Russian president, a founding member, took part virtually as there's an arrest warrant against him issued by the International Criminal Court.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Turkey's central bank has raised its key interest rate to 25 percent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's an increase of 7.5 percent and is being seen as a sign of a return to more conventional economic policies. It backtracks from a rate-cutting course set by President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, which had been blamed by some economists for inflaming a cost-of-living crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Many households in Turkey have been struggling to cover the cost of rent and basic goods as inflation surged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Analysts are predicting investors will be reassured by the move.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: are predicting investors will be reassured by the move.

sentences.sentence: Firefighters are continuing to battle wildfires near the northeastern Greek town of Alexandropolis six days after the blaze began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, people are just beginning to assess the human cost and damage to property.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Euronews has been to some of the areas destroyed by the fires.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: to property. Uranus has been to some of the areas destroyed by the fires.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Just a few kilometres north of Alexandroupoli, you can see how devastating the fire was here in this village. There are about 10 houses which have been burned to the ground. There is no way that the people can come back and live here because it's just unliveable is no windows left no room roof left and you can see that even though the the fire has been put out we still have to wear masks because of all the the fumes in the air it's just so difficult to breathe and you can see in this way over the hills and nothing has been left because of the fire and it seems like nothing could have stopped the fire because here it's very hot it's very dry and it's windy at some moments which makes you know all these conditions make the flames even bigger and spread even easier and this is a situation like in 80 percent of the territory here in Greece because of the wind, the fumes are spread throughout the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: As far as 950 kilometers to the southwest, reaching some Italian islands, which is very difficult to breathe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And some beach goers, when they go to the beach, when they lay to sunbathe, when they see up, they see ash coming from the sky.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And in this direction, over the hill, in the mountains, the bodies where 18 illegal immigrants were found dead, they were coming in through Turkey, they swam over the river, they came here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And you know, when immigrants come to Europe, they don't have any documents, they don't have any money, they don't have phones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's a controversial decision drawing significant criticism. On Thursday, Japan began discharging wastewater from the Fukushima nuclear power plant into the Pacific Ocean.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The discharge is considered a necessary step towards decommissioning the plant, which was destroyed by a tsunami in 2011.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Japanese government was given the green light by the UN nuclear watchdog,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: which says the water was treated and safe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, there are many in Japan who believe otherwise and are publicly expressing their disapproval.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Many gathered in Tokyo on Wednesday to protest the plan. Why is this country not listening to our voice, the voice of fishermen?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's a concern shared by Japan's neighbors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: South Korea saw multiple protests erupt over the discharge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the seafood markets are also worried.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Consumers' distrust of the fish and seafood harvested in this shared sea could sink sales.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A survey found that 80% of respondents opposed the Japanese plan, while 60% said they wouldn't eat seafood after the water release began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Chinese government has called the spill an act of selfishness and has banned all imports of Japanese seafood without ruling out further measures to safeguard food safety for the public.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: measures to safeguard food safety for the public. The head of Spain's football federation, Luis Rubiales, is to resign on Friday following his non-consensual kiss of the player Jennifer Hermoso.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: World football's governing body, FIFA, launched a disciplinary case after Rubiales grabbed and kissed the player after she and her team won the Women's World Cup in Australia on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: His actions triggered a barrage of outrage online, including from Spain's secretary for sport, with many seeing it as an example of lingering sexism in football.
